summary: An email chain forwarded by attorney Stacey Richman to a U.S. Attorney's office, containing a forwarded email from Mark L. Epstein that includes a threatening message sent to him. The threat demands he tell the court he partnered with his brother or his family will be killed.

events.title: Threatening Email Sent to Mark L. Epstein
events.description: An individual using the alias 'Puggie' sends an email to Mark L. Epstein threatening to kill his family if he does not tell the court he partnered with his brother.

events.title: Attorney Forwards Threat to Authorities
events.description: Attorney Stacey Richman forwards the threatening email chain to a U.S. Attorney's office, expressing serious concern and seeking advice.

keyFacts: A direct death threat was sent via email to Mark L. Epstein on May 25, 2020, demanding he make a false statement to a court about partnering with his brother.
Attorney Stacey Richman considered the threat serious and aggressive enough to forward it to a U.S. Attorney's office for advice.
The threat suggests Mark L. Epstein was involved in a court proceeding where the nature of his partnership with his brother was relevant.
The communication shows a potential attempt to intimidate or influence a legal proceeding involving Mark L. Epstein.
